question: First sign of puberty in females is?
exp: ANSWER: (B) Thelarche. REF: Nelson Textbook of Paediatrics 17th edition page 1882, http://en. wikipedia. org/wiki/Puberty. Repeat in December 2009. In girls, the breast bud (Thelarche) is usually the first sign of puberty (10-11 yr), followed by the appearance of pubic hair 6-12 months later. The interval to menarche is usually 2-2. 5 yr but may be as long as 6 yr. Peak height velocity occurs early (at breast stage II--III, typically between 11 and 12 yr of age) in girls and always precedes menarche.
